title: IFI16 knockdown in primary HIV-1 target cells
procedures:
Step-by-step method details
Step-by-step method details
siRNA transfection of macrophages
Timing: 11 days
This step explains the procedure to transfect siRNAs in MDMs.
Remove medium from plated macrophages and add 500 μL fresh DMEMxxx (supplemented with 10% (v/v) heat-inactivated FCS, L-glutamine (2 mM), streptomycin (100 μg/mL) and penicillin (100 U/mL))
Transfect with siRNA (45 nM final molarity) using Lipofectamine RNAimax (preferentially done during late afternoon to reduce Lipofectamine-derived cellular toxicity)
Prepare (scale according to the number of samples) the following master mixes
Tube 1: 3 μL Lipofectamine + 75 μL OptiMEM
Tube 2: 1.46 μL siRNA (stock concentration: 20 μM) + 75 μL OptiMEM
Add contents of tube 1 to tube 2 and mix by pipetting
Incubate for 10 min at 22°C–23°C
Drop 150 μL of the Lipofectamine-siRNA complex solution onto the cells in a dropwise manner. When all the required wells have been transfected, gently rock the plate to evenly distribute the liposome complexes.
Morning of the following day: remove medium and add 750 μL fresh MDM medium (DMEM0xx + 10% (v/v) human serum + 15 ng/ mL M-CSF) (this step is roughly done at 14 h post siRNA transfection)
Early morning of three days post transfection, remove medium from cultured macrophages and add 500 μL fresh DMEMxxx
Repeat point 2.
Incubate cells for 1 week at 37°C in a 5% CO2 incubator.
Critical: always consider doing siRNA transfection in technical duplicates. siRNA master mixes have to be prepared under the flow hood. Disinfect the working area with 70% isopropanol and inactivate any residual nucleases with RNase away.
Validation of knockdown efficiency
Timing: 2 days
This step illustrates processing of cells for western blot analysis
At 1 week post transfection, harvest and lyse cells for western blot
Remove supernatants.
Add 500 μL PBS.

Remove PBS and add 100 μL western blot lysis buffer (150 mM NaCl, 50 mM HEPES, 5 mM EDTA, 0.1% NP40, 500 μM Na3VO4, 500 μM NaF, pH 7.5) supplemented with Complete ULTRA protease inhibitor cocktail tablet (1 pill/10 mL) (this step should be done one plate at the time).
Leave the plate for 3 min on ice.
Carefully rinse the well and pool cell lysates from the same technical replicates into a 1.5 mL Eppendorf tube.
Vortex 1 s and incubate on ice for 20 min.
Vortex 1 s and centrifuge lysates at 20,817 rcf for 20 min at 4°C.
Add 90 μL of supernatants to 30 μL of loading dye (90% (v/v) 4× loading dye + 10% (v/v) β-mercaptoethanol).
Heat at 95°C for 5 min.
Freeze at −20°C.
SDS-PAGE Immunoblot
Load 15–20 μL of cell lysates on a NuPAGE 4%–12% Bis-Tris gel (Invitrogen) and run them for 90 min at 120 V.
Transfer proteins on an Immobilion-FL Transfer PVDF Membranes (Merck Millipore) with the Trans-Blot SD Semi-Dry Transfer Cell for 2 h.
Block the membrane with 5% milk (w/v) in PBS-T (0.02% Tween (v/v)).
Stain membranes with anti-IFI16 (1G7) mouse (stock concentration: 200 μg/mL; working dilution: 1:150) and anti-GAPDH (W17079A[href=https://www.biolegend.com/en-us/search-results?Clone=W17079A]) rat (stock concentration: 0.5 μg/μL; working dilution: 1:1,000) antibodies.
Quantify band intensities using Image Studio Lite Ver 5.0.
Transfection of CD4+ T lymphocytes with shRNA
Timing: 1 h
Nucleofection of CD4+ T lymphocytes with shRNA to downregulate expression of IFI16.
Remove the anti-CD3/CD28 magnetic beads from CD4+ T lymphocytes
Resuspend cells thoroughly to separate cells from the beads.
Transfer cells in an appropriate tube size and place it on a magnet.
Wait 10 min.
Transfer cells into a fresh tube.
Count the cells.

Prepare 12 well plate with 1.5 mL of RPMI 20% (v/v) FCS, IL-2 (10 ng/mL) and L-glutamine (2 mM) without antibiotics (RPMIxx)/well. Place it into the cell culture incubator (37°C, 5% CO2).
Pre-warm Human T cell nucleofector solution with added supplement (delivered together with the kit).
Prepare cuvettes.
Take 6 million CD4+ T lymphocytes per sample.
Centrifuge cells at 393 rcf for 3 min at 22°C–23°C and remove the supernatant as much as possible.
Add 100 μL of T cell nucleofector solution, add 1.5 μg of IFI16 shRNA, gently mix, and transfer into the cuvette.
Place the cuvette into the Amaxa device and pulse the sample with U15 program.
Immediately transfer the sample into the medium in the 12 well plate (one sample/well).
Critical: For primary CD4+ T lymphocytes transfection, it is important to use high purity DNA.
Validation of knockdown efficiency
Timing: 2 days
This step describes how to determine the knockdown efficiency via western blot analysis.
Harvest and lyse cells
72 h after transfection, harvest one million cells and centrifuge them at 393 rcf for 5 min at 22°C–23°C.
Remove the medium and add 500 μL of PBS.
Centrifuge at 393 rcf for 5 min at 22°C–23°C.
Remove the supernatant and add 100 μL of western blot lysis buffer (150 mM NaCl, 50 mM HEPES, 5 mM EDTA, 0.1% (v/v) NP40, 500 μM Na3VO4, 500 μM NaF, pH 7.5) supplemented with protease inhibitor.
Vortex and incubate on ice for 10 min.
Centrifuge for 20 min at 20,817 rcf at 4°C.
Transfer the supernatant in a new 1.5 mL Eppendorf tube.
Measure protein concentration using the Nanodrop. Normalize protein concentration for each donor with CoIP lysis buffer.

Transfer 30 μL of supernatants in a new 1.5 mL Eppendorf tube and add 10 μL of loading dye (90% (v/v) 4× loading dye + 10% (v/v) β-mercaptoethanol).
Heat at 95°C for 10 min.
Freeze at −20°C.
Perform western blot analysis as described in the siRNA section (points 8 and 9).
gRNA/Cas9 nucleofection of CD4+ T lymphocytes
Timing: 4 days
This step accomplishes the gRNA/Cas9 nucleofection
Mix 80 pmol Cas9 and 240 pmol sgRNA in a final volume of 5 μL.
Incubate the complex for 20 min at 22°C–23°C.
Prior to nucleofection, prepare the nucleofector master mix.
For the mix use 82% (v/v) of the Lonza P3 Primary Cell Solution and 18% (v/v) of the supplement 1 for a total volume of 20 μL for one nucleofection.
In the meantime, remove the anti-CD3/CD28 magnetic beads from the CD4+ T lymphocyte culture and transfer 1 million cells in a new 1.5 mL Eppendorf tube (use one tube per reaction).
Spin down the cells and carefully remove the medium.
Add 20 μL of nucleofector master mix and straight afterward the gRNA/Cas9 complex to the cells, mix gently, and transfer it in the nucleofection strip. Avoid making the bubbles.
Insert the strip in the 4D Nucleofector Core Unit and chose the pulse code EO115.
Add 80 μL warm RPMIxx supplemented with 20% (v/v) FCS and IL-2 (10 ng/mL) to the strip and incubate in cell culture incubator for 10 min.
Add 200 μL warm RPMIxx with 20% (v/v) FCS and IL-2 (10 ng/mL) in a 48 well plate, transfer the electroporated cells in the plate and culture for 14 h at 37°C, 5% CO2.
On the following day, add 300 μL of warm RPMIxx with 20% (v/v) FCS and IL-2 (10 ng/mL). Transfer cells in a 24 well plate. (See Troubleshooting 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#sec7.1])

48 h post nucleofection, supplement the culture with 500 μL fresh RPMIxx with 20% (v/v) FCS and IL-2 (10 ng/mL). If necessary, transfer the cells in a bigger culture format.
Critical: Keep in mind the toxicity of the nucleofector master mix and never leave the cells in it for more than 15 min before nucleofection.
Proving knockout efficiency via western blot
Timing: 2 days
This step describes how to determine the knockout efficiency via western blot analysis.
Harvest and lyse cells
96 h after nucleofection, harvest one million cells and centrifuge them at 393 rcf for 5 min at 22°C–23°C.
Remove the medium and add 500 μL of PBS.
Centrifuge at 393 rcf for 5 min at 22°C–23°C.
Remove the supernatant and add 100 μL of western blot lysis buffer (150 mM NaCl, 50 mM HEPES, 5 mM EDTA, 0.1% (v/v) NP40, 500 μM Na3VO4, 500 μM NaF, pH 7.5) supplemented with protease inhibitor.
Vortex and incubate on ice for 10 min.
Centrifuge for 20 min at 20,817 rcf at 4°C.
Transfer the supernatant in a new 1.5 mL Eppendorf tube.
Measure protein concentration using the Nanodrop. Normalize protein concentration for each donor with CoIP lysis buffer.
Transfer 30 μL of supernatants in a new 1.5 mL Eppendorf tube and add 10 μL of loading dye (90% (v/v) 4× loading dye + 10% (v/v) β-mercaptoethanol).
Heat at 95°C for 10 min.
Freeze at −20°C.
Perform western blot analysis as described in the siRNA section (points 8 and 9). (See Troubleshooting 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#sec7.3])
